homepage.info: If you'd like to make Factsplat your landing page for your web browser, please do the following steps.
homepage.step_4: Re-start your browser and you're good to go!
homepage.openPage: Open a specific page or set of pages
homepage.noBrowserSupported: It seems that you're using a browser that we currently do not have steps to help you set Factsplat as your homepage. Feel free to send to us steps.

chrome.step_1: In the top right corner of your browser, click {dots-vertical} then {settings}

firefox.step_1: In the top right corner of your browser, click {menu} then {settings}
firefox.step_2: Under {home}, select {customUrl} in the dropdown menu for {homepageAndWindow}.
firefox.step_3: Copy-paste {factsplatUrl} in the field that appears.

safari.step_1: In the Safari app choose {safari} > {preferences}, then click {general}
safari.step_2: In the homepage field, type in {factsplatUrl}.
safari.step_3: Choose when your homepage is shown
safari.step_3_1: {openWindows}: Click the “New windows open with” pop-up menu, then choose Homepage
safari.step_3_2: {openTabs}: Click the “New tabs open with” pop-up menu, then choose Homepage.

cursive.openWIndows: Open new windows with your homepage
cursive.openTabs: Open new tabs with your homepage

edge.step_1: In the top right corner of your browser, click {dots-horizontal}then {settings}.

createASplat-Description.thereAreTwoDifferentWays: There are 2 different ways to create a splat.
createASplat-Description.firstCreateFromHome: First, you can create a new splat from the ‘{Home}’ menu or from one of your splats:
createASplat-Description.opt11: Open the ‘{newDroplet}’ menu (the blue button in the top right corner of your splat), select {splatLink}, then {createANewSplat}. Alternatively, you can right click inside the splat and select {createANewSplat}.
createASplat-Description.opt12: Choose a name for your splat and select a privacy level.
createASplat-Description.opt13: A link to your new splat is added in your splat. Click on it to open it, and start collecting and organizing links and notes.
createASplat-Description.createFromSplatsMenu: The other option is to create a splat from the ‘{splats}’ menu:
createASplat-Description.opt21: Click on the ‘{newSplat}’ button or the ‘{pluss}’ card.
createASplat-Description.opt22: Choose a name for your splat and select a privacy level.
createASplat-Description.opt23: Your new splat opens. Start collecting and organizing links and notes, and use the ‘{addToAnotherSplat}’ feature (first icon in the top left corner of your splat, next to the splat name) to add a link to this splat in your home or in one of your other splats.

guideSection.setUpASplat-D1: To set up a splat, you need to add droplets. There are different types of droplets: notes, resources (i.e. links to documents, websites, etc.), collections (i.e. groups of resources), and splat links (i.e. links to other splats).
guideSection.setUpASplat-D1-2: {importantNote}: The first splat that you should set up is your homesplat.
guideSection.setUpASplat-D2: To add droplets inside a splat, open the ‘{newDroplet}’ menu (the blue button in the top right corner of your splat) and select the type of droplet. Alternatively, you can right click and select the type of droplet you want to add. Repeat the operation until you have added all the links and notes that you need.
guideSection.setUpASplat-D3: To rearrange the droplets inside your splat, you must enable the drag by clicking on the “{doubleArrow}” button (second button in the top right corner of your splat). Once it is enabled, you can move the droplets, and drag resources in and out collections. Disable the drag button once you are satisfied with your layout.
guideSection.buildMyHomesplat-1: Your homesplat is the splat featured in the ‘{Home}’ menu. It is supposed to be your new starting point when navigating the internet, and should feature the resources and splats you need quick access to.
guideSection.buildMyHomesplat-2: Your homesplat can be set up the same way as any other splat, by adding and organizing droplets. To help you, we have already added some droplets (a note, a few resources and a few splat links). Feel free to delete them and replace them with what you need.
guideSection.buildMyHomesplat-3: If you like the structure and/or content of some of the splat examples we have provided you, you can copy them to make them your own and edit them. To make a copy of a splat, you have 2 options:
guideSection.buildMyHomesplat-o1: In your homesplat, hover over the splat link, click on {dotsImage} and select {copySplat}.
guideSection.buildMyHomesplat-o2: Open the splat, open the dropdown menu next to the splat name by clicking on {arrowImage} and select {copySplat}.
guideSection.buildMyHomesplat-4: Once you have made a copy of a splat, you can edit the content to adapt it to your needs, and delete the initial splat from your homesplat.
guideSection.shareASplat-1: There are different ways to share a splat, depending on who you want to share it with.
guideSection.shareASplat-2: If you want to share a splat with everyone, make it public in the ‘{sharingSettings}’ menu (the eye icon in the top right corner of the splat) and share the link to your splat. Everyone will be able to see the content of the splat, whether they are Factsplat users or not.
guideSection.shareASplat-3: If you want to share a splat with someone who is already registered on Factsplat, you need to:
guideSection.shareASplat-p1: Add this user as your friend from the ‘{Users}’ menu. Search for his name or username and send a friend request. Once they have accepted your friend request, you can go to the next step. {Note}: You don’t need to go through this first step if you want to share a splat with a member of your organization.
guideSection.shareASplat-p2: Inside the splat you want to share, open the ‘{Collaborators}’ menu (first button in the top right corner of the splat). Type in the name and select the user in the dropdown menu.
guideSection.shareASplat-p3: Select the access right you want to give the user to your splat: {admin}, {editor} or {reader}.
guideSection.shareASplat-4: If you want to share a splat with someone who is not registered on Factsplat, you need to:
guideSection.shareASplat-p4: Inside the splat you want to share, open the ‘{Collaborators}’ menu (first button in the top right corner of the splat) and click on ‘{addSomeoneElse}’
guideSection.shareASplat-p5: Enter the email addresses of the people you want to share the splat with, tick the box if you want to add them as friends, and select the access right you want to give them to your splat.
guideSection.shareASplat-p6: The people will receive an email invitation and will have access to your splat after registration. If needed, you can cancel the invite in the ‘{Collaborators}’ menu.
guideSection.shareASplat-5: If you want to share a private splat with many people and only give them reading access, you can:
guideSection.shareASplat-p7: Inside the splat you want to share, open the ‘{sharingSettings}’ menu (the eye icon in the top right corner of the splat).
guideSection.shareASplat-p8: Click on {newLink}, select an expiration time for your link in the dropdown menu, and click on {saveLink}.
guideSection.shareASplat-p9: Share the link that was generated with people, and they will be able to see the content of the splat, until the link expires.

helpSection.needHelp: If you need any help please contact us at {supportMail}
